definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Inscribed with a dozen or more function scales, the slide rule symbolized the mysteries of arcane science.
sentences.chinese: 计算尺上刻著十几种函数刻度，宛如科学奥秘的化身。

sentences.english: Chenrezig is the embodiment of love and compassion.
sentences.chinese: 观音是爱与慈悲的化身。

sentences.english: Fully describe the activities of Lord Hari's incarnations within this universe.
sentences.chinese: 完整讲述了主哈尔依在这个宇宙中的化身的活动。

sentences.english: Jesus has often been referred to by classic theologians as "the avatar of God."
sentences.chinese: 耶稣经常被传统神学家视为“上帝的化身。”

sentences.english: But Manjushri's incarnation, they love it.
sentences.chinese: 但是文殊菩萨的化身，他们喜欢。

sentences.english: To them, he personified absolut power.
sentences.chinese: 在他们看来，他就是绝对权力的化身。

sentences.english: Divine Incarnations belong to this class.
sentences.chinese: 神的化身属于这一类型。

sentences.english: Small qian incarnation book fairy meet, hand to tear to refuse his love poem.
sentences.chinese: 小倩化身簿仙子相见，一手将情诗撕毁拒绝他的情意。

sentences.english: He was a sort of almost irritating ubiquity; no halt was possible with him.
sentences.chinese: 他几乎是一种激奋的化身，有了他，便不可能有停顿。

sentences.english: Formed of the sand, and fit to shift and break.
sentences.chinese: 你，只是沙器构成的化身。

sentences.english: Red is romantic, because red is the color of love and passion.
sentences.chinese: 红色是浪漫的，因为红色是爱和激情的化身。

sentences.english: Cease, dreams, the images of our day-desires.
sentences.chinese: 停止吧，梦靥，白昼欲望的化身。

sentences.english: Originally, the radiant sun is the embodiment of three -legged crow.
sentences.chinese: 原来，光芒四射的太阳只是三足乌鸦的化身。

sentences.english: I am an immaterial impalpable incarnation.
sentences.chinese: 我是一个非物质的无形化身。

sentences.english: Do you believe that Jesus is God incarnate, God in the flesh?
sentences.chinese: 你相信耶稣是上帝的化身，上帝的肉体吗？

sentences.english: A curtain of rain, like the embodiment of the bead curtain wind for gas filling of things.
sentences.chinese: 卷一帘细雨，想化身这珠帘随风化为气充盈万物间。

definition: (of a spirit or deity) to possess sb
human shape/in human form/of human appearance/doll/puppet
to combine/combination/composite character (i.e. a synonym of 合體字|合体字[he2 ti3 zi4])/(of clothes) to be a good fit
the real body (of Buddha or a God)/true effigy
to change shape in a single shake/fig. to take on a new lease of life
lit. to shake one's body/refers to abrupt transformation/same as 搖身一變|摇身一变
